definition: too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.

sentences.english: Then my grandpa died after a couple of days. I am so regretful that I can never forgive myself.
sentences.chinese: 沒過幾天爺爺就去世了，我真是後悔莫及。

sentences.english: Or become an old man, filled with regret, waiting to die alone!
sentences.chinese: 難道等你老了，再後悔莫及，一人孤老而終嗎？

sentences.english: Carry me over the river, or else you will regret.
sentences.chinese: 把我背過河去，不然會後悔莫及的。

sentences.english: Everywhere runs into a wall, I think that time, own definitely can rude awakening.
sentences.chinese: 處處碰壁，我覺得那個時候，自己肯定會後悔莫及。

sentences.english: A personal current become to calculate, if not and quickly carry on, necessarily go to too late to regret.
sentences.chinese: 一個人既有成算，若不迅速進行，必至後悔莫及。

definition: lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
